title: What are interviewers looking for when they ask - 'What is your ideal project'? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is sometimes a trap question, specially when you don’t have clarity of type of project for which you are being hired. They are sometimes checking your thought process and priorities. This is also to check your flexibility about any kind of project / work. For example, you say any large complex development project or if you talk about specific tools & technologies then they will take you only if they have the same to offer in short to medium term future. If you are really particular about it then it’s okay to state your priorities. Like any project on the analytics or machine learning. If they don’t have that kind of project, they won’t take you but that’s what you also want. I generally say - any project which intellectually challenges me to put my best and if I see that I am adding value for the organization & end customer then that’s ideal project for me.
